PPMonth.notes:
Thank you to this month's author: Scott D. Farquhar (Baltimore, MD)
We've prepared a spoiler-free [sheet of musical terms](musical_terms.pdf) if you're not musically inclined.

puzzle.title: Choir Rehearsal
puzzle.hint: Have no fear - no music knowledge is nessesary
Connect the dots
Do the lines cross something?
The solution is THE FOOD OF LOVE.

puzzle.title: Too Much Triangle
puzzle.hint: There are many references to the number 3 (title, composer, etc.). This is important
Use only every 3rd measure
Only the notes matter, not the rests
It's morse

puzzle.title: Music Arranging
puzzle.hint: Match up like type of notes.
This should have made letters
Order by length of note (use tip sheet if you need to)

puzzle.title: The Lost and Disorganized Pianist
puzzle.hint: LEFT and RIGHT are very important.
If the directions say LEFT, use the bottom staff, if it is says right, use top staff.
LEFT and RIGHT use different encodings.
RIGHT is Semaphore, LEFT is Braille
Translated numbers tell you what measure to use.
Order by the list on the bottom

puzzle.title: Jazz Witches
puzzle.hint: 3 types of encodings are used
Encodes are Hexidecmial, binary, and decimal
Order by the number on the measure

puzzle.title: The Grand Finale (meta puzzle)
puzzle.hint: Take the note letter names for the notes that are connected by a musical tie.
A BAD EGG
Use Pi as 3.14159 and take those measure numbers from the original puzzle.
REPEAT REPEAT
Caesar shift from G (G Clef) and F (F Clef).
LET'S POLKA
Take the note letter names for the notes connected by a musical slur.
FEED A BEE A CABBAGE
Use Solfege to get the final answer
